Portuguese (Portugal) (pt-PT)

  • Marketing guide to Firefox localization

Guia de localizaÃ§Ã£o de conteÃºdos do Firefox

Este documento visa facilitar a criaÃ§Ã£o e localizaÃ§Ã£o de textos e prestar apoio para uma boa preparaÃ§Ã£o e consistÃªncia dos conteÃºdos. Ã um documento permanentemente em aberto e que reflete o nosso momento atual. Ã medida que a expressÃ£o da nossa marca continua a evoluir, iremos continuar a efetuar atualizaÃ§Ãµes a este documento.

Por que motivo este guia Ã© importante para a localizaÃ§Ã£o dos conteÃºdos de marketing do Firefox?

Este guia destina-se a permitir compreender melhor o Firefox enquanto marca, para perceber qual a melhor abordagem na traduÃ§Ã£o de conteÃºdos para o seu idioma. Adicionalmente, iremos partilhar escolhas de palavras e de ortografia especÃ­ficas da empresa que visam facilitar o processo de localizaÃ§Ã£o.

Os nossos textos nÃ£o devem ser traduzidos literalmente, palavra por palavra, devem sim refletir a personalidade e o tom da nossa marca e ser otimizados para transmitir a perspetiva cultural e linguÃ­stica mais adequada. A intenÃ§Ã£o emocional e figurativa do texto de origem deve ser adaptada para a lÃ­ngua de chegada.

Sobre o Firefox â Quem somos

O Firefox Ã© mais que um simples browser. O Firefox Ã© uma marca desafiante que desafia o status quo e defende os direitos online dos utilizadores.

Em tudo o que fazemos, colocamos os direitos e as necessidades dos utilizadores em primeiro lugar. E, enquanto empresa de tecnologia que somos, damos prioridade Ã s pessoas face aos lucros.

O Firefox enquanto marca combina o ethos Firefox e os nossos produtos relacionados.

(A Mozilla Ã© a entidade sem fins lucrativos que suporta o Firefox.)

A Promessa da marca:

A Firefox luta por si

Objetivos pelos quais lutamos:

O Firefox luta pelos seus utilizadores atravÃ©s da criaÃ§Ã£o de produtos que dÃ£o Ã s pessoas poder e controlo sobre as suas vidas online.

Produtos:

  • Firefox Quantum (navegador para Desktop)
  • Firefox Mobile (para iOS e Android)
  • Firefox Monitor
  • Pocket
  • Mozilla VPN
  • Firefox Private Network (FPN)
  • Firefox Relay

Personalidade e tom de voz

Para quem estamos a falar?

Descrevemos o nosso pÃºblico-alvo como Consumidores Conscientes. Este conceito refere-se a pessoas que tomam ou pretendem tomar decisÃµes conscientes, tanto online como offline.

Consumidores Conscientes:

  • Desenvolvem preferÃªncias e tomam decisÃµes de consumo cuidadosas e conscientes
  • Procuram por conciliar as suas aÃ§Ãµes com os seus valores e ideais
  • SÃ£o clientes exigentes
  • Muitas vezes fazem as suas prÃ³prias pesquisas para perceberem bem todas as opÃ§Ãµes de que dispÃµem

Dentro dos Consumidores Conscientes, existem dois grupos com os quais tentamos falar especificamente. "Preocupados com a Confidencialidade" e "Aventureiros Amplificadores".

Preocupados com Confidencialidade:

  • Muito provavelmente jÃ¡ sÃ£o utilizadores do Firefox
  • DÃ£o prioridade Ã  privacidade e estÃ£o dispostos a gastar dinheiro para garantir a sua seguranÃ§a digital
  • Acreditam que a internet tem a responsabilidade de proteger os seus cidadÃ£os

Amplificadores aventureiros:

  • Seguidores de tendÃªncias e definidores de tendÃªncias
  • Querem que os seus amigos e seguidores testemunhem as boas escolhas que estÃ£o a fazer
  • EsforÃ§am-se por influenciar a sua comunidade para que esta tambÃ©m faÃ§a escolhas ponderadas

Os Atributos da Marca e a Personalidade da Marca Firefox

AtributoPersonalidade da marca Firefox
OpiniÃµes FortesO Firefox possui convicÃ§Ãµes fortes e assume posiÃ§Ãµes claras com confianÃ§a. Os nossos produtos mostram que a nossa motivaÃ§Ã£o tem origem na nossa visÃ£o da marca. O nosso ethos da marca estÃ¡ na raiz de tudo o que fazemos. E Ã© isso que queremos comunicar aos nossos utilizadores e parceiros.
AberturaO Firefox acha que a internet deve ser aberta, acessÃ­vel e segura para todos. EsforÃ§amo-nos por garantir a existÃªncia de colaboraÃ§Ã£o e de uma discussÃ£o aberta. Temos: Mente aberta. CoraÃ§Ã£o aberto. CÃ³digo aberto. Possuir uma perspetiva global Ã© uma parte integrante da nossa marca. Falamos muitas lÃ­nguas e tentamos ter perspetivas diferentes.
GenerosidadeO Firefox antecipa necessidades, oferecendo soluÃ§Ãµes e alternativas em situaÃ§Ãµes nas quais a liberdade e os direitos dos utilizadores sÃ£o ameaÃ§ados ou abusados. Queremos o melhor para os nossos utilizadores e para o mundo, por isso lideramos pelo exemplo. Desenvolvemos melhores produtos, iniciÃ¡mos diÃ¡logos, trabalhamos de forma aberta e em conjunto com outros, formamo-nos a nÃ³s prÃ³prios e aos outros e informamos os nossos utilizadores. Ao fazÃª-lo, atuamos com empatia em relaÃ§Ã£o a todas as pessoas.
RadicalO Firefox pÃµe em causa a ordem instalada e as prÃ¡ticas comuns das gigantes tecnolÃ³gicas e dÃ¡ passos corajosos para criar uma internet melhor. Ter um olhar otimista sobre o futuro da internet Ã© uma atitude radical. Colocar as necessidades dos utilizadores antes das nossas prÃ³prias necessidades Ã© igualmente radical. Desafiamos a ordem instalada porque pensamos que esse Ã© o caminho mais correto a seguir.

A Personalidade da Marca Firefox Ã© definida pela interaÃ§Ã£o destes atributos. Dependendo do contexto, um atributo pode ser mais ou menos destacado.

Tom de voz

O nosso tom de voz e as nossas escolhas de linguagem sÃ£o:

Tom de voz
Direto, claro e fÃ¡cil de compreenderQueremos que os utilizadores se sintam bem-vindos e utilizamos palavras e conceitos que todos compreendam.
ConcisoGostamos de tÃ­tulos e de frases curtas e de "call-to-action" claros. Tentamos evitar frases com uma estrutura complicada ou que nÃ£o trazem qualquer valor acrescentado.
AutÃªnticoOs nossos textos â tal como os nossos produtos â sÃ£o criados por humanos para humanos. Comunicamos com os nossos utilizadores de igual para igual e utilizamos linguagem natural.
NaturalEscrevemos utilizando a voz ativa e utilizamos a voz passiva com moderaÃ§Ã£o. Evitamos o estilo nominal. Preferimos duas frases curtas a uma frase longa.
RespeitosoSomos respeitosos sem parecermos demasiado formais.
Bem-humoradoSomos divertidos sem nos tornarmos demasiado ligeiros ou vulgares.
RelevanteVamos ter com os nossos utilizadores onde quer que eles estejam. Os utilizadores devem poder perceber rapidamente o nosso conteÃºdo e sentir uma ligaÃ§Ã£o pessoal connosco. As referÃªncias culturais tÃªm de fazer sentido e estar adaptadas ao mercado, nunca devendo ser traduzidas de forma literal, sem o contexto cultural adequado.
Otimista e motivadorAcreditamos num futuro positivo para a internet. Embora por vezes falemos de algumas coisas que nÃ£o correm assim tÃ£o bem, preferimos sempre adotar uma perspetiva positiva.
CriativoEmbora a informaÃ§Ã£o e a clareza venham em primeiro lugar, tambÃ©m gostamos de utilizar linguagem criativa e interessante nos nossos textos. Nunca queremos parecer insÃ­pidos nem aborrecidos. Tentamos evitar os estereÃ³tipos de marketing.

GlossÃ¡rio de termos/Termos comuns (TRABALHO EM DESENVOLVIMENTO)

Em caso de dÃºvida, podemos sempre efetuar uma pesquisa no transvision. No entanto, como muitas vezes a pesquisa apresenta versÃµes anteriores das traduÃ§Ãµes na lista de resultados (muitas vezes com a forma de tratamento formal), esta ferramenta deverÃ¡ ser utilizada apenas como guia.

Ghidul stilistic Ã®n cadrul localizÄrilor romÃ¢neÈti pentru Mozilla

Ãn primul rÃ¢nd ca localizator/traducÄtor ar trebui sÄ vÄ asiguraÈi de cunoaÈterea foarte bunÄ a limbii romÃ¢ne. Este necesarÄ Èi o cunoaÈtere bunÄ a limbii engleze scrise.

Regula principalÄ

DacÄ nu are sens pentru mine, atunci Ã®n mod clar traducerea este greÈitÄ.

Principii generale

  • Claritatea -- PreferÄm claritatea mesajului chiar cu sacrificarea traducerii directe, Ã®n special Ã®n cazurile Ã®n care sensul original este ceva mai dificil de redat Ã®n limba romÃ¢nÄ. Este important ca programele sÄ fie Ã®nÈelese de utilizatori Èi de audienÈa adresatÄ. Nu se acceptÄ totuÈi modificarea mesajului traducerii dincolo de intenÈia textului din limba originalÄ (engleza), traducerea propriu-zisÄ trebuie sÄ fie cÃ¢t mai clarÄ fÄrÄ a pierde esenÈa textului original. DacÄ ar fi necesarÄ reformularea textului original, acest lucru ar trebui raportat prin Bugzilla prin deschiderea un bug.
  • Diacritice -- Limba romÃ¢nÄ utilizeazÄ diacritice Èi folosirea acestora nu este opÈionalÄ. Mai mult de atÃ¢t, trebuie utilizate diacriticele corecte, cu virgulÄ: ÈÈ ÈÈ (corect) Èi nu sedilÄ: ÅÅ Å¢Å£(greÈit). ObsevaÈi forma diacriticei de sub literÄ.

Ce nu trebuie tradus

Deseori, Èirurile conÈin elemente ce sunt relevante pentru programatori Èi care ar trebui identificate de localizatori, chiar dacÄ nu trebuie sÄ Ã®nÈelegem precis rolul lor. De cele mai multe ori, acestea reprezintÄ Èabloane pentru alt text (de ex. &brandName; ce poate sÄ Ã®nsemne âFirefoxâ sau âThunderbirdâ pentru acele Èiruri din interfaÈÄ comune celor douÄ programe).

SituaÈia e mai complicatÄ pentru cÄ uneori acele Èiruri reprezintÄ entitÄÈi HTML, precum &amp; (&) sau &hellip; (â¦) , care reprezintÄ caractere de text, nu termeni programatici. Ampersandul de obicei se traduce ca âÈiâ, dar sunt excepÈii.

Mai multe informaÈii de pe ghidul L10n.ro.

MÄrcile Mozilla

MÄrcile Mozilla, numele produselor etc. sunt nume proprii Èi Ã®n general nu se traduc. Spre ex. âMozilla Foundationâ este o entitate Ã®nregistratÄ din SUA Èi numele acesteia nu se traduce sub nicio formÄ.

Termeni

  • Majoritatea termenilor din IT au o traducere specificÄ Ã®n romÃ¢nÄ. Este foarte importantÄ menÈinerea consecvenÈei acestor traduceri. DacÄ nu ÈtiÈi traducerea adecvatÄ consultaÈi Transvision pentru exemple din Èirurile deja traduse. Din pÄcate, nu toÈi aceÈti termeni sunt Ã®ncÄ definitivaÈi Èi Ã®ncÄ mai sunt inconsistenÈe Ã®ntre programe, dar Ã®ncercÄm sÄ menÈinem aceeaÈi terminologie peste Ã®ntreg proiectul Mozilla.

GreÈeli frecvente

Ghid de exprimare corectÄ

GreÈeli frecvente din traducerea de programe

Forme de plural

Forma de adresare

Sunt trei moduri de adresare: personalÄ, politicoasÄ Èi impersonalÄ. Istoric Èi Ã®n unele proiecte de programe libere se preferÄ o adresare politicoasÄ (cÃ¢nd calculatorul apeleazÄ utilizatorul -- de ex. âDoriÈi schimbarea culorii?â sau âComanda dumneavoastrÄ a fost acceptatÄâ), personalÄ (cÃ¢nd utilizatorul adreseazÄ o comandÄ programului -- de ex. âTipÄreÈteâ) Èi impersonalÄ (cÃ¢nd este vorba de butoanele meniurilor unei aplicaÈii -- de ex. âVizualizareâ).

La Mozilla din motive de consistenÈÄ, simplitate Èi pentru scurtarea traducerilor s-a decis de ceva timp folosirea exclusivÄ a adresÄrii personale, dar respectuoasÄ (fÄrÄ tutuiri). Sunt Ã®n continuare proiecte Ã®n cadrul Mozilla Ã®n care puteÈi remarca adresare politicoasÄ. Pe viitor vom Ã®ncerca sÄ le reparÄm Èi sÄ folosim strict adresare personalÄ peste tot. Ãn foarte puÈine cazuri atunci cÃ¢nd contextul este incert se mai poate folosi adresarea impersonalÄ.

Exemple:

Butoane sau elemente de meniu:

Text original:  Open
Traducere:      Deschide

Text original:  Save
Traducere:      SalveazÄ

Text original:  Search Files
Traducere:      CautÄ fiÈiere

CÃ¢nd calculatorul solicitÄ utilizatorul sÄ ia o decizie, sau cÃ¢nd calculatorul Ã®nÈtiinÈeazÄ utilizatorul cu privire la o acÈiune pe care acesta (utilizatorul) trebuie sÄ o ia:

Text original:  Do you want to continue?
Traducere:      DoreÈti sÄ continui?

Text original:  Please try again later.
Traducere:      Te rugÄm sÄ Ã®ncerci din nou mai tÃ¢rziu.

Text original:  You have exceeded the number of registration attempts for this session.
                Please try again later.
Traducere:      Ai depÄÈit numÄrul de Ã®ncercÄri de Ã®nregistrare pentru aceastÄ sesiune.
                Te rugÄm sÄ Ã®ncerci din nou mai tÃ¢rziu.

CÃ¢nd calculatorul raporteazÄ o stare sau o acÈiune pe care o realizeazÄ fÄrÄ intervenÈia utilizatorului se foloseÈte forma reflexivÄ, calculatorul fiind o entitate abstractÄ, nu o persoanÄ sau un personaj:

Text original:     Could not open file %s
Traducere corectÄ: Nu s-a putut deschide fiÈierul %s (sau Imposibil de deschis fiÈierul)

Text original:     Receiving data from %s
Traducere corectÄ: Se primesc date de la %s

Text original:     Saving configuration
Traducere corectÄ: Se salveazÄ configuraÈia

Pentru butoane care conduc la meniuri adiÈionale (fÄrÄ acÈiune imediatÄ), sau poziÈii de meniu care deschid submeniuri, sau meniuri care constituie titluri ale unor submeniuri, se recomandÄ folosirea formei impersonale:

Text original:     Manage...
(context: buton a cÄrui singurÄ acÈiune este deschiderea unui meniu adiÈional)
Traducere recomandatÄ: Gestionare...

A se vedea Èi discuÈia imperativ versus impersonal Ã®n meniuri cu puncte-puncte pe marginea acestei reguli.

Pentru titlurile ferestrelor se foloseÈte forma impersonalÄ:

Text original:  Saving configuration
Traducere:      Salvarea configuraÈiei

Text original:  Manage Media Usage Rights
Traducere:      Gestionarea drepturilor de utilizare media

Trebuie evitate expresiile cacofonice Ã®n traducerile reflexive, folosiÈi modul impersonal:

Text original:     Press OK to save the session
Traducere corectÄ: ApasÄ Ok pentru a salva sesiunea

PrescurtÄrile

Trebuiesc evitate prescurtÄrile gen âdvs.â Ã®n loc de âdumneavoastrÄâ, ori nu-i Ã®n loc de nu e sau nu este. Ãn mod uzual acestea sunt Ã®ntÃ¢lnite Ã®n expresii cu multe cuvinte, dialoguri explicative, de configurare, sau de eroare, (foarte) rar Ã®n meniuri, de aceea lungimea cuvintelor nu constituie o problemÄ criticÄ.

Genul

Trebuiesc evitate discriminÄrile pe bazÄ de sex Èi formulÄrile deranjante de genul el/ea, prin folosirea, pe cÃ¢t posibil, a unui limbaj impersonal. De asemenea, pentru a evita frustrarea utilizatorului la vederea unui program care i se adreseazÄ nesigur, Ã®n ambele genuri, este mai bine sÄ se evite genul cÃ¢nd se poate.

Text original:     Are you sure you want to delete this bookmark?
Traducere corectÄ: Sigur doreÈti sÄ Ètergi acest semn de carte?

Contextul

Este o informaÈie suplimentarÄ despre locul Ã®n care apare textul respectiv (nu apare mereu). Ãn exemplul de mai jos, fiind vorba de âNicknameâ, uzual traducerea este cu âPseudonimâ, aÈadar traducerea corectÄ este cea la masculin.

Text original:     (not yet valid)
(context: un nume ce nu este valid)
Traducere corectÄ: (Ã®ncÄ nu este valid)

Pluralul

DeÈi mulÈi nu suntem conÈtienÈi de acest lucru, limba romÃ¢nÄ are douÄ forme de plural (una fÄrÄ âdeâ, cealaltÄ cu âdeâ) Èi forma de singular. La Èirurile cu forme de plural trebuie aÈadar 3 traduceri: singularul, pluralul fÄrÄ âdeâ Èi pluralul cu âdeâ.

1 ou, 2 ouÄ, 3 ouÄ, ... 10 ouÄ, 20 **de** ouÄ, ..., 101 ouÄ, 102 ouÄ, 120 **de** ouÄ.

Pentru mai multe detalii citiÈi pagina dedicatÄ acestui subiect.

Majusculele

Nu trebuie folosite majuscule pentru fiecare cuvÃ¢nt Ã®ntr-un meniu, titlu, etc (doar Ã®n limba englezÄ cuvintele Ã®ncep cu majuscule Ã®n titlu).

Text original:           Save As...
Traducere corectÄ:       SalveazÄ ca...

Text original:           Control Center
Traducere corectÄ:       Centru de control

Topica expresiilor

Topica expresiilor trebuie Ã®n general inversatÄ:

Text original:           An error occurred.
Traducere corectÄ:       S-a produs o eroare.

Text original:           Something wrong has happened.
Traducere corectÄ:       S-a Ã®ntÃ¢mplat ceva prost.

Acceleratori

Acceleratorii sunt scurtÄturile din meniuri Èi panourile de configurare, sunt identificaÈi prin cuvinte ce conÈin o literÄ subliniatÄ, iar acea intrare de meniu sau configurare poate fi activatÄ folosind combinaÈia de taste Alt + tasta subliniatÄ. Ei sunt marcaÈi Ã®n textele de tradus prin precedarea literei subliniate fie cu _ (linie joasÄ) fie cu & (ampersand).

Litera de dupÄ accelerator este cea care apare subliniatÄ Ã®n elementul de meniu. De ex. pentru Èirul E_diteazÄ, d va apÄrea subliniat.

Se Ã®ncearcÄ pÄstrarea aceloraÈi taste ca din englezÄ, iar atunci cÃ¢nd nu existÄ o literÄ corespondentÄ Ã®n cuvÃ¢ntul tradus, vom elimina acceleratorul din cuvÃ¢ntul tradus (practic se eliminÄ â&â sau ââ din traducerea romÃ¢neascÄ chiar dacÄ vedeÈi â&â sau ââ Ã®n englezÄ). Pentru Firefox, netraducerea acceleratorului va avea ca efect afiÈarea literei Ã®ntr-o parantezÄ la sfÃ¢rÈit: de ex. EditeazÄ (x). FiÈi fÄrÄ griji, nu este nicio problemÄ dacÄ â&â sau â_â lipsesc din traducerea romÃ¢neascÄ.

Ghilimele

Ãn limba romÃ¢nÄ singurele ghilimele acceptate sunt âtextâ Èi âtext Â«altcevaÂ» textâ (pentru citat Ã®n citat) adicÄ: ghilimele deschise, ghilimele Ã®nchise Èi ghilimele franceze.

Folosirea apostrofului (') sau a ghilimelelor duble (") din repertoriul ASCII este greÈitÄ. Detalii despre ghilimelele folosite Ã®n limba romÃ¢nÄ se pot gÄsi la http://www.acad.ro/alteInfo/ghilimele.doc

Neologisme

Folosirea cratimei Ã®n neologisme

Articolul hotÄrÃ¢t enclitic (singular Èi plural) se leagÄ cu cratimÄ numai Ã®n Ã®mprumuturile neadaptate: - a cÄror finalÄ prezintÄ deosebiri Ã®ntre scriere Èi pronunÈare: bleu- ul [blÃ¶ul]; - care au finale grafice neobiÈnuite la cuvintele vechi din limba romÃ¢nÄ: dandy-ul (nu dandiul), dandy-i ; gay-ul, gay-i; hippy-ul, hippy-i; party-ul; playboy-ul, playboy-i; story-ul, story-uri.

Se recomandÄ ataÈarea fÄrÄ cratimÄ a articolului la Ã®mprumuturile - chiar nedaptate sub alte aspecte - care se terminÄ Ã®n litere din alfabetul limbii romÃ¢ne pronunÈate ca Ã®n limba romÃ¢nÄ: gadgetul [gheÄetul], weekendul [uÄ­kendul], inclusiv Ã®n cazul unor anglicisme ceva mai vechi, scrise Èi conform DOOM1 fÄrÄ cratimÄ: westernuri È.a.

http://acad.ro/alteInfo/nouDOOM.doc

CÃ¢teva exemple:

web-ul = greÈit
webul = corect

blogul / blogurile = corect

Genul neologismelor

Neologismele din domeniul IT sunt preluate cu genul neutru, ele fiind inanimate.

driver / drivere
browser / browsere
player / playere

Adaptarea la situaÈii extreme

Ce facem cÃ¢nd Ã®ntalnim o situaÈie unde termenii traduÈi, puÈi cap la cap nu par sÄ dea sensul dorit:

Tile children
(TapeteazÄ copii?)

Ok, dupÄ ce s-a dus zÃ¢mbetul, Ã®ncercaÈi sÄ deduceÈi sensul expresiei, din context; Ã®n exemplul de faÈÄ este vorba despre afiÈarea ferestrelor âcopilâ astfel Ã®ncÃ¢t sÄ ocupe tot spaÈiul disponibil; Ã®n acest caz, expresia cea mai intuitivÄ pentru utilizator este:

Ferestre alÄturate

sau eventual

Ferestre Ã®n mozaic

Astfel, urmeazÄ morala: nu trebuie sÄ vÄ feriÈi de traduceri mai âÃ®ndrÄzneÈeâ, atunci cÃ¢nd sensul unei expresii poate fi Ã®mbunÄtÄÈit. AveÈi Ã®nsÄ grijÄ ca Ã®n cazurile Ã®n care expresia mai apare Èi Ã®n alte locuri (fiÈiere), traducerea sÄ fie fÄcutÄ Ã®ntr-o manierÄ consecventÄ.

Ð Firefox â ÐºÑÐ¾ Ð¼Ñ

ÐÐ¾Ð´Ð»Ð¸Ð½Ð½ÑÐ¹ÐÐ°ÑÐ¸ ÑÐµÐºÐ»Ð°Ð¼Ð½ÑÐµ ÑÐµÐºÑÑÑ (ÐºÐ°Ðº Ð¸ Ð½Ð°ÑÐ° Ð¿ÑÐ¾Ð´ÑÐºÑÐ¸Ñ) ÑÐ¾Ð·Ð´Ð°ÑÑÑÑ Ð»ÑÐ´ÑÐ¼Ð¸ Ð´Ð»Ñ Ð»ÑÐ´ÐµÐ¹. ÐÑ ÑÐ°Ð·Ð³Ð¾Ð²Ð°ÑÐ¸Ð²Ð°ÐµÐ¼ Ñ Ð¿Ð¾Ð»ÑÐ·Ð¾Ð²Ð°ÑÐµÐ»ÑÐ¼Ð¸ Ð½Ð° ÑÐ°Ð²Ð½ÑÑ Ð¸ Ð¸ÑÐ¿Ð¾Ð»ÑÐ·ÑÐµÐ¼ Ð¿ÑÐ¸Ð²ÑÑÐ½ÑÐ¹ Ð¸Ð¼ ÑÐ·ÑÐº.
ÐÐ°ÑÑÐ¾ÑÑÐ¸Ð¹ÐÑ ÑÐ°ÑÑÐ¾ Ð¸ÑÐ¿Ð¾Ð»ÑÐ·ÑÐµÐ¼ Ð² Ð¿Ð¸ÑÑÐ¼ÐµÐ½Ð½ÑÑ ÑÐµÐºÑÑÐ°Ñ Ð°ÐºÑÐ¸Ð²Ð½ÑÐ¹ Ð·Ð°Ð»Ð¾Ð³ Ð¸ Ð³Ð¾ÑÐ°Ð·Ð´Ð¾ ÑÐµÐ¶Ðµ â Ð¿Ð°ÑÑÐ¸Ð²Ð½ÑÐ¹. ÐÑ ÑÑÐ°ÑÐ°ÐµÐ¼ÑÑ Ð½Ðµ Ð¸ÑÐ¿Ð¾Ð»ÑÐ·Ð¾Ð²Ð°ÑÑ Ð½Ð°Ð·ÑÐ²Ð½ÑÐµ Ð¿ÑÐµÐ´Ð»Ð¾Ð¶ÐµÐ½Ð¸Ñ. ÐÐµÐ¶Ð»Ð¸Ð²ÑÐ¹ÐÑÐ´ÑÑÐµ Ð²ÐµÐ¶Ð»Ð¸Ð²Ñ, Ð½Ð¾ Ð½Ðµ Ð¸ÑÐ¿Ð¾Ð»ÑÐ·ÑÐ¹ÑÐµ ÑÐ»Ð¸ÑÐºÐ¾Ð¼ Ð¾ÑÐ¸ÑÐ¸Ð°Ð»ÑÐ½ÑÐ¹ ÑÑÐ¸Ð»Ñ

Pontoon

ÐÐ¾ÐºÐ°Ð»Ð¸Ð·Ð°ÑÐ¸ÑÐ° Mozilla Ð¿ÑÐ¾Ð¸Ð·Ð²Ð¾Ð´Ð° ÑÐµ Ð²ÑÑÐ¸ Ð¿ÑÐµÐºÐ¾ Ð¿Ð»Ð°ÑÑÐ¾ÑÐ¼Ðµ Pontoon. ÐÐ° ÑÐ¾Ñ ÑÐµ Ð½Ð°Ð»Ð°Ð·Ðµ ÑÐ²Ð¸ Ð¿ÑÐ¾Ð¸Ð·Ð²Ð¾Ð´Ð¸ ÐºÐ¾ÑÐ¸ ÑÑ ÑÐ°Ð²Ð½Ð¾ Ð´Ð¾ÑÑÑÐ¿Ð½Ð¸ ÐºÐ¾ÑÐ¸ÑÐ½Ð¸ÑÐ¸Ð¼Ð°, Firefox, Firefox Ð·Ð° Android, Thunderbird, Mozilla.org, Ð¸ÑÐ´.

ÐºÐ°Ð¾ ÑÐºÑÐ°ÑÐµÐ½Ð¸ÑÐ°, ÑÐµ Ð½Ðµ Ð¿ÑÐµÐ²Ð¾Ð´Ðµ Ð¸ Ð¾ÑÑÐ°ÑÑ Ð½Ð° Ð¾ÑÐ¸Ð³Ð¸Ð½Ð°Ð»Ð½Ð¾Ð¼ ÑÐµÐ·Ð¸ÐºÑ (Ð½Ð¿Ñ. HTTP, HTTPS, SEO, APIâ¦).

Ð Ð²Ð¾Ð´Ð¸ÑÑ

ÐÐ²Ð¾Ð¼ Ð²Ð¾Ð´Ð¸ÑÑ ÑÑ Ð´Ð¾Ð¿ÑÐ¸Ð½ÐµÐ»Ð¸ ÑÐ»Ð°Ð½Ð¾Ð²Ð¸ Ð½Ð°ÑÐµ Ð·Ð°ÑÐµÐ´Ð½Ð¸ÑÐµ ÐÐ°ÑÐºÐ¾ ÐÐ½Ð´ÑÐµÑÐ¸Ñ Ð¸ ÐÐ°ÑÐºÐ¾ ÐÐ¾ÑÑÐ¸Ñ ÑÐ· Ð¿Ð¾Ð´ÑÑÐºÑ Ð²Ð¾Ð»Ð¾Ð½ÑÐµÑÐ° Ð¸Ð· Ð´ÑÑÐ³Ð¸Ñ Ð³Ð»Ð¾Ð±Ð°Ð»Ð½Ð¸Ñ Mozilla Ð·Ð°ÑÐµÐ´Ð½Ð¸ÑÐ°.

ÐÐ¾Ð´Ð¸Ñ ÑÐµ ÑÑÐ°ÑÐµÐ½ Ð¿Ð¾ ÑÐ·Ð¾ÑÑ Ð½Ð° Ð²Ð¾Ð´Ð¸Ñ âÐÐ½Ð¾Ð¼Ð¾Ð² Ð¿ÑÐ°Ð²Ð¾Ð¿Ð¸Ñ Ð¸ ÑÐµÐ·Ð¸Ðº Ð¿ÑÐµÐ²Ð¾Ð´Ð° (2011)â.

ÐÐ²Ð°Ñ Ð²Ð¾Ð´Ð¸Ñ ÑÐµ Ð¸Ð·Ð´Ð°Ñ Ð¿Ð¾Ð´ Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International (CC BY-SA 4.0) Ð»Ð¸ÑÐµÐ½ÑÐ¾Ð¼. ÐÐ¸ÑÐµ Ð¾ Ð¾Ð²Ð¾Ñ Ð»Ð¸ÑÐµÐ½ÑÐ¸, Ð¼Ð¾Ð¶ÐµÑÐµ Ð¿ÑÐ¾ÑÐ¸ÑÐ°ÑÐ¸ Ð¾Ð²Ð´Ðµ

Style Guide Sinhala (si)

Mozilla à¶´à¶»à·à·à¶»à·à¶­à¶± à¶¸à¶à¶´à·à¶±à·à·à·à¶¸

à¶´à¶»à·à·à¶»à·à¶­à¶± à¶¸à¶à¶´à·à¶±à·à·à·à¶¸à· à¶à¶´à· à¶´à¶»à·à·à¶»à·à¶­à¶±à¶ºà¶ à¶­à¶­à·à·à¶º à¶­à·à¶»à¶«à¶º à¶à¶»à¶± à¶¸à·à¶±à·à¶¸ à·à¶³à·à¶±à· à·à·. Mozilla à¶±à·à¶¸à·à¶ºà·à¶¸à·, à·à·à¶¶à· à¶´à·à¶§à· à·à· à¶à¶±à·à¶à·à¶­à· à·à·à¶ºà·à¶´à·à¶­à·à¶±à·à·à· à¶´à¶»à·à·à¶»à·à¶­à¶± à¶à¶»à¶±à·à¶±à· à¶à·à·à·à¶¯ à¶ºà¶±à·à¶± à¶´à·à·à·à¶¶à¶³ Mozilla à·à· Mozilla à¶´à¶»à·à·à¶»à·à¶­à¶± à¶à¶«à·à¶©à·à¶ºà¶¸à· à·à·à·à·à¶±à· à¶´à·à·à·à¶§à·à·à¶± à¶½à¶¯ à¶±à·à¶­à· à¶»à·à¶­à· à¶¸à·à·à· à¶à¶©à¶à¶à· à·à·à¶ºà·. à¶´à¶»à·à·à¶»à·à¶­à¶± à¶¸à¶à¶´à·à¶±à·à·à·à¶¸ à¶´à¶»à·à·à¶»à·à¶­à¶± à¶à·à¶»à·à¶¸ à·à¶³à·à· à¶¸à·à¶±à·à¶¸ à¶´à¶»à·à·à¶»à·à¶­à¶±à¶ºà¶ à¶­à¶­à·à·à¶º à¶±à·à¶»à·à¶«à¶º à¶à·à¶»à·à¶¸ à·à¶³à·à·à¶¯ à¶·à·à·à·à¶­à· à·à·à¶ºà·. à¶¸à·à¶¸ à¶±à·à¶­à· à¶»à·à¶­à· à¶´à·à·à·à¶´à·à¶¯à·à¶¸ à¶¸à¶à·à¶±à· Mozilla à¶à¶à¶ºà¶±à· à·à· à·à¶à·à·à¶à·à¶­à·à¶º à¶±à·à¶»à·à¶´à¶±à¶ºà·à¶± à¶­à¶­à·à·à¶ºà·à¶±à· à·à¶©à·à¶­à· à¶à·à·à· à¶´à¶»à·à·à¶»à·à¶­à¶±à¶ºà¶à· à¶à·à¶»à·à¶¸ à¶à·à·à·à¶®à·à· à¶´à¶»à·à·à¶»à·à¶­à¶à¶ºà·à¶à·à¶§ à¶½à·à¶¶à·.

à¶¸à·à¶¸ à¶¸à¶à¶´à·à¶±à·à·à·à¶¸ à¶à·à¶§à·à· à¶¯à·à¶à¶à·à¶±à· à·à¶¸à¶±à·à·à·à¶­ à·à·à¶ºà·: à¶´à·à¶¸à· à¶à·à¶§à·à· Mozilla à·à·à¶à·à¶½ à¶´à¶»à·à·à¶»à·à¶­à¶± à¶´à·âà¶»à¶¢à·à· à·à·à·à·à¶±à· à¶´à·à·à·à¶ºà·à· à¶à¶»à¶± à¶½à¶¯ à¶·à·à·à· à¶¸à·à¶½à·à¶ à¶±à·à¶­à· à¶»à·à¶­à· (à¶·à·à·à· à¶¸à·à¶½à·à¶ à·à·à¶½à·à·, à¶´à·à¶»à·à¶·à·à·à·à¶ à·à¶ à¶± à·à· à¶¸à·à¶±à·à¶¸à· à¶à¶à¶ à¶à¶¯à·à¶º à¶à·à¶»à¶«à¶ºà·à¶± à¶´à¶»à·à¶¯à·) à·à¶³à·à¶±à·à·à¶± à¶à¶­à¶» à¶¯à·à·à¶± à¶à·à¶§à·à· à¶à¶¶à¶§ à·à¶©à·à¶­à· à·à·à¶³à·à¶±à· à¶´à¶»à·à·à¶»à·à¶­à¶± à¶à·à¶»à·à¶¸ à·à¶³à·à· Mozilla à·à·à·à·à¶±à· à·à·à¶ºà·à· à¶·à·à·à· à·à¶³à·à· à¶±à·à¶»à·à¶«à¶º à¶à¶»à¶± à¶½à¶¯ à·à·à¶¸à·à¶±à·âà¶ºà¶º à¶±à·à¶­à· à¶»à·à¶­à· (à¶±à·à¶»à·à¶¯à·âà¶ºà¶­à·à· à·à· à·à·âà¶ºà¶à·à¶­à¶·à·à·à¶º à¶´à·à·à·à¶¶à¶³ à¶¸à·à¶½à¶°à¶»à·à¶¸ à¶à·à¶»à¶«à¶ºà·à¶± à¶´à¶»à·à¶¯à·) à·à¶³à·à¶±à· à·à·à¶ºà·.

à¶·à·à·à·-à¶¸à·à¶½à·à¶ Mozilla à¶´à¶»à·à·à¶»à·à¶®à¶± à·à·à¶à·à·à¶¸

à¶´à¶»à·à·à¶»à·à¶®à¶± à·à·à¶à·à·à¶¸ à¶±à·à¶»à·à¶«à¶º à¶à·à¶»à·à¶¸à·à¶¯à· à¶·à·à·à·à·à· à·à·à¶°à·à¶¸à¶­à· à¶¶à· à·à· Mozilla l10n à·à·âà¶ºà·à¶´à·à¶­à·à¶ºà¶§ à·à·à¶°à·à¶¸à¶­à· à·à¶¬ à¶·à·à·à·à¶­à¶º à¶±à·à¶»à·à¶«à¶º à¶à·à¶»à·à¶¸à· à¶¯à· à·à·à¶½à¶à·à¶º à¶ºà·à¶­à· à¶´à·âà¶»à¶°à·à¶± à¶à¶»à·à¶«à· à·à¶½à¶à· à¶¶à¶½à¶¸à·.

à¶¸à·à¶¸ à·à·âà¶ºà·à¶´à·à¶­à·à¶º à¶à¶½à¶à·à¶ à¶à¶»à¶± à¶´à¶»à·à·à·à¶½à¶à¶ºà· à¶à·à·à¶¯? à¶à·à·à¶à· à¶´à·à·à¶¶à·à¶¸ à¶à·à¶¸à¶à·à¶¯? à¶à¶½à¶à·à¶à¶à¶­ à¶´à¶»à·à·à·à¶½à¶à¶ºà· à¶¸à·à¶¸ à·à·âà¶ºà·à¶´à·à¶­à·à¶º à·à¶¸à¶ à¶à¶±à·à¶­à¶»à·à¶à·âà¶»à·à¶ºà· à¶à·à¶»à·à¶¸à¶§ à¶à¶¯à·à·à· à¶à¶»à¶±à·à¶±à· à¶à·à·à·à¶¯? à¶à¶¯à·à·à¶«à¶ºà¶à· à¶½à·à·, à¶à·à·à¶±à· à·à¶»à¶½, à¶¸à·à¶­à·âà¶»à·à·à¶½à· à¶à¶±à·à¶­à¶»à·à¶à·âà¶»à·à¶ºà·à·à¶à· à¶¶à¶½à·à¶´à·à¶»à·à¶­à·à¶­à· à·à¶±à·à¶±à·à¶¯? à¶à¶´à¶à· à¶·à·à·à·à· à·à¶³à·à· à·à¶± à·à·à¶ºà·à· Mozilla L10n à·à·âà¶ºà·à¶´à·à¶­à· à·à¶³à·à· à·à·à¶°à·à¶¸à¶­à· à¶·à·à·à·à· à¶à·à¶½à¶´à·à¶±à·à¶±à·à¶¯, à¶à·à· à¶±à·à·à¶±à·à¶±à· à¶à·à¶¸à¶± à¶à·à·à·à¶®à· à·à¶½à¶¯à·à¶¯? à¶à¶´à¶à· à¶·à·à·à·à· à·à¶³à·à· à·à¶± à·à·à¶ºà·à· Mozilla L10n à·à·âà¶ºà·à¶´à·à¶­à· à·à¶³à·à· à¶à·à·à¶°à·à¶¸à¶­à· à¶·à·à·à·à· à¶à·à¶½à¶´à·à¶±à·à¶±à·à¶¯, à¶à·à· à¶±à·à·à¶±à·à¶±à· à¶à·à¶¸à¶± à¶à·à·à·à¶®à· à·à¶½à¶¯à·à¶¯?

à¶¸à·à¶½à·à¶à·, à¶¯à·à·à·à¶ºà¶à¶»à¶«à¶ºà·à¶¯à· à¶à¶±à·à·à·âà¶º à¶½à·à· à·à·à¶°à·à¶¸à¶­à· à¶¶à· à¶à·à¶½ à·à· à¶´à·à· à¶¯à·à¶¸à·à¶¸ à·à·à¶¯à· à¶±à·à¶à· à¶ºà·à¶­à·à¶ºà·. à¶¸à·à¶ºà¶§ à¶à¶¯à·à·à¶»à¶«à¶º à·à¶±à·à¶±à·, "à¶à·à¶½à·à¶à· à¶à¶»à¶±à·à¶±" (à¶à·à·à¶°à·à¶¸à¶­à·) "à¶à¶»à·à¶«à·à¶à¶» à¶¸à·à·à· à¶à·à¶½à·à¶à· à¶à¶»à¶±à·à¶±" (à·à¶©à· à·à·à¶°à·à¶¸à¶­à·). à¶­à·à¶¯ à¶·à·à·à·à·à· à¶·à·à·à·à¶­à¶º à·à¶¸à·à¶´à·à¶»à·à¶« à·à·âà¶ºà·à¶´à·à¶­à·à¶º à¶­à·à·à¶¸ à¶à¶à·à¶à·à¶»à· à·à·à¶º à¶ºà·à¶­à·à¶ºà·.

à·à·à·à¶·à·à·à·à¶ à¶´à·âà¶»à¶à·à·à¶±à¶º (Natural expression)

à·à·à·à¶·à·à·à·à¶ à¶´à·âà¶»à¶à·à·à¶±à¶ºà¶±à· à¶·à·à·à·à¶­à¶ºà·à¶±à· à¶à¶¶à· à¶¯à·à·à·à¶ºà¶à¶»à¶«à¶º à¶à¶º à¶à·à¶ºà·à¶±à·à¶±à·à¶§ à·à¶©à· à·à·à·à¶¶à·à·à·à¶ à¶¶à·à¶à· à¶à¶à· à¶à¶»à¶ºà·. à¶à¶¶à¶à· à¶´à¶»à·à·à¶»à·à¶®à¶±à¶º à¶´à·à·à·à¶à¶­à· à¶·à·à·à· à¶±à·à¶ºà·à¶¸à¶à¶ºà¶±à·à¶à·à¶±à· à¶¶à·à·à·à¶»à· à¶¯à·à·à·à¶º à·à· à·à·à·à¶·à·à·à·à¶ à¶´à·âà¶»à¶à·à·à¶±à¶ºà¶±à· à¶à¶©à¶à¶à· à¶à¶» à¶à¶­à· à·à·à¶§ à¶½à·à¶¶à·à¶± à¶´à·âà¶»à¶®à·à¶´à¶½à¶º à¶¯à·à¶»à·à·à¶½ à·à·. à¶´à¶»à·à·à¶»à·à¶®à¶±à¶ºà·à¶¯à· à¶¸à· à¶´à·à·à·à¶¶à¶³à· à·à¶©à·à¶­à· à·à·à¶½à¶à·à¶½à·à¶¸à¶­à· à·à·à¶¸à¶§ à¶±à·à¶»à·à¶¯à·à· à¶à¶»à¶±à·à¶±à·à¶¸à·. à¶à¶¯à·à·à¶»à¶«à¶ºà¶à· à·à·à¶ºà·à¶±à· "From Scratch" à¶ºà¶±à·à¶± à·à¶»à¶½ à¶´à¶»à·à·à¶»à·à¶®à¶±à¶ºà·à¶¯à· "à·à·à¶»à·à¶¸à·à¶±à·" à¶ºà¶±à·à·à·à¶±à· à¶ºà·à¶¯à·à¶± à¶±à¶¸à·à¶­à· à¶à·à· à·à¶­à·âà¶º à¶­à·à¶»à·à¶¸ "à¶¸à·à¶½ à·à·à¶§ à¶à¶»à¶¹à·à¶¸" à·à·.

à·à·à¶à·à¶½ à¶·à·à·à·à·à· à·à· à¶à¶à¶à·âà¶»à·à·à· à¶·à·à·à·à·à· à·à·âà¶ºà·à¶à¶»à¶« à·à·à¶±à· à¶±à·à·à·à¶»à¶¯à· à¶½à·à· à¶´à¶»à·à·à¶»à·à¶­à¶±à¶º à·à·à¶º à¶ºà·à¶­à·à¶º. à¶à¶¶à·à·à·à¶±à· à¶´à¶»à·à·à¶»à·à¶­à¶±à¶ºà·à¶¯à· à¶½à¶¶à·à¶¯à·à¶¸à¶§ à¶à¶­à·à·à·à· à¶à¶»à¶± à¶à¶¯à·à· à¶±à·à·à·à¶»à¶¯à·à· à·à¶§à·à¶±à· à·à·à¶¸à¶§ à¶±à¶¸à· à¶¸à·à¶¸ à·à·à¶±à·à·à¶à¶¸à· à¶´à·à·à·à¶¶à¶³à· à·à·à·à¶à·à¶½à·à¶¸à¶­à· à·à·à¶¸ à·à·à¶¯à¶à¶­à·à¶º. à¶´à·à¶­ à¶à¶¯à·à·à¶»à¶«à¶ºà·à¶¯à· â#1â à¶¸à¶à·à¶±à· à·à¶à¶à·âà¶ºà·à·à¶à· à¶¯à¶à·à·à¶± à¶à¶­à¶» à¶ à¶à¶±à·à· à¶à·à· à·à·à¶®à·à¶±à¶º à·à·à¶±à·à· à¶à¶» à¶±à·à·à·à¶»à¶¯à· à¶à¶¯à·à· à¶½à¶¶à·à¶¯à·à¶º à¶ºà·à¶­à·à¶º.

  • âDownloading and verifying add-onâ¦;Downloading and verifying #1 add-onsâ¦â
  • âà¶à¶©à·à¶± à¶¶à·à¶à¶­ à¶à¶»à¶¸à·à¶±à· à·à· à¶´à·à¶»à·à¶à·à·à¶¸à·à¶±à· à·à·à¶§à·à¶ºà·â¦;à¶à¶©à·à¶± #1 à¶¶à·à¶à¶­ à¶à¶»à¶¸à·à¶±à· à·à· à¶´à·à¶»à·à¶à·à·à¶¸à·à¶±à· à·à·à¶§à·à¶ºà·â¦â

à¶à·âà¶»à·à¶ºà·à¶´à¶¯ à¶´à¶»à·à·à¶»à·à¶­à¶±à¶ºà·à¶¯à· à¶à¶¯à·à¶»à·à¶´à¶­à· à¶à·à¶»à·à¶¸à¶§ à¶¶à¶½à·à¶´à·à¶»à·à¶­à·à¶­à· à·à¶± à¶à¶¯à·à·à¶§ à·à·à¶±à·à¶ºà¶à· à¶±à·à·à¶± à¶´à¶»à·à¶¯à· à·à·à¶à· à¶­à¶»à¶¸à· à¶à·à¶§à·à¶à¶» à¶¯à·à¶à·à·à·à¶¸à·à¶±à· à¶¸à·à¶±à·à·à· à·à· à¶¯à·à· à·à¶§à·à¶±à· à¶à¶º à¶¯à¶»à·à·à¶«à¶º à·à·à¶¸ à¶´à·à·à· à¶à¶»à·à¶±à· à¶à¶­.

à¶à¶¯à·à·à¶»à¶« à¶½à·à· âAnalyseâ à¶´à¶»à·à·à¶»à·à¶­à¶±à¶ºà·à¶¯à· âà·à·à·à·à¶½à·à·à¶«à¶ºâ à¶½à·à· à¶¯à·à¶à·à·à·à¶¸ à¶´à·âà¶»à¶¸à·à¶«à·à¶­à· à·à¶± à¶à¶­à¶» âà·à·à·à·à¶½à·à·à¶«à¶º à¶à¶»à¶±à·à¶±â à¶½à·à· à¶¯à·à¶à·à·à·à¶¸ à¶à·à·à·âà¶º à¶±à·à·à·. âBack to Topâ à¶´à¶»à·à·à¶»à·à¶­à¶±à¶ºà·à¶¯à· âà¶ºà·à· à¶à·à·à¶§à¶¸â à¶½à·à· à¶¯à·à¶à·à·à·à¶¸ à¶´à·âà¶»à¶¸à·à¶«à·à¶­à· à·à¶± à¶à¶­à¶» âà¶ºà·à· à¶à·à·à¶§à¶¸ à¶ºà¶±à·à¶±â à¶½à·à· à¶¯à·à¶à·à·à·à¶¸ à¶à·à·à·âà¶º à¶±à·à·à·.

Guidelines

In this section, form guidelines for how to perform a natural sounding localization. This might take some time and experience to find the right examples to include or create the right guidelines for your language.

Handling cultural references, idioms, and slang

Cultural references, idioms, and slang require a full understanding of these references between the cultures of your source and target languages. An example of a cultural reference in English would be the phrase, "kick-off meeting." This is a reference that uses an American football term. It means a meeting to begin a project. To translate it, you can follow one of two approaches:

Find an equivalent reference phrase in your language. Remove the cultural reference and translate the core meaning (e.g., "a commencement meeting")

Define a policy for handling these cultural references, idioms, and slang that you can make standard across all projects. Consider resources you can refer back to in order to find cultural equivalents and list them in this section of your style guide (e.g., a slang dictionary in your language).

Style consistency

à¶´à¶»à·à·à¶»à·à¶­à¶± à·à·âà¶ºà·à¶´à·à¶­à·à¶ºà¶à· à¶´à·à¶»à·à·à¶§à¶¸ Mozilla à·à· à¶­à·à·à·à¶±à· à¶´à·à¶»à·à·à·à·à¶º à·à¶±à·à¶±à·à¶¸ à·à· à·à·à¶½à·à· à¶¸à¶à¶´à·à¶±à·à·à·à¶¸à·à·à¶½à¶§ à¶à¶»à·à¶à¶½ à¶ºà·à¶­à·à¶ºà·. Mozilla à¶¸à·à¶½à·à¶ à·à¶±à·à¶±à·à¶¸ à¶±à·à¶­à· à·à¶³à·à· à·à·à¶©à·à¶¯à·à¶» à·à·à·à·à¶­à¶» à·à¶³à·à· https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/styleguide/identity/firefox/branding/ à·à·à¶­ à¶´à·à·à·à·à·à¶±à·à¶±. à¶à¶¯à·à·à¶»à¶«à¶ºà¶à· à¶½à·à· "Firefox" à·à·à¶±à· à·à¶±à·à¶±à·à¶¸ à¶±à·à¶¸ à¶à·à·à·à¶­à·à¶¸ à¶´à¶»à·à·à¶»à·à¶­à¶±à¶º à¶±à·à¶à· à¶ºà·à¶­à·à¶ºà·. à·à¶±à·à¶±à·à¶¸ à¶¸à¶à¶´à·à¶±à·à·à·à¶¸à· à¶±à·à¶­à· à¶à¶±à·à¶à·à¶­à· à·à¶±à·à¶±à·à¶¸ à¶´à¶»à·à·à¶»à·à¶­à¶±à¶º à¶à· à¶ºà·à¶­à·à¶¯ à¶±à·à¶­à·à¶¯ à¶ºà¶±à·à¶± à·à·à¶à·à¶½ à¶´à¶»à·à·à¶»à·à¶­à¶± à¶´à·âà¶»à¶¢à·à· à¶½à·à· à¶à¶´ à¶­à·à¶»à¶«à¶º à¶à¶½ à¶ºà·à¶­à·à¶ºà·. à·à¶±à·à¶±à·à¶¸ à¶±à·à¶¸ à¶´à¶»à·à·à¶»à·à¶­à¶±à¶º à¶à·à¶»à·à¶¸à¶§ à¶­à·à¶»à¶«à¶º à¶à·à¶»à·à¶¸à¶§ à¶´à·à¶» à·à¶±à·à¶±à·à¶¸ à¶±à·à¶¸ à¶´à·à·à·à¶¶à¶³ à·à·à¶´à¶»à·à¶à·à·à·à¶à·à¶»à· à·à¶±à·à¶± (Mozilla à·à· à¶à¶±à·à¶à·à¶­à· à¶­à·à·à·à¶±à· à¶´à·à¶»à·à·à·à·à¶º à·à¶±à·à¶±à·à¶¸ à·à¶³à·à·). à¶à·à·à¶±à· à·à¶±à·à¶±à·à¶¸ à¶´à¶»à·à·à¶»à·à¶­à¶± à¶´à·à·à·à¶¶à¶³ à¶¸à·à¶¸ à¶´à·à¶§à·à· à¶ºà·à·à¶­à·à¶à·à¶½ à¶à·à¶»à·à¶¸à¶§ à¶à·à¶»à·à¶«à·à¶ à·à·à¶±à·à¶±.

à¶´à¶»à·à·à¶»à·à¶­à¶±à¶ºà·à¶¯à· à¶¯à·à¶±à¶§ à¶·à·à·à·à¶­à·à·à¶±, à·à·à·à·à·à·à·à·à¶­ à·à· à¶à¶¯à·à¶½ à·à·à¶à·à¶½ à·à¶ à¶± à¶¸à·à¶½ à¶·à·à¶ à·à¶­à· à¶à·à¶»à·à¶¸à¶§ à·à¶à¶¶à¶½à·à¶à¶±à·à¶±. à¶´à·à¶­ à·à¶³à·à¶±à· à¶à¶»à·à¶«à· à¶±à·à¶à·à¶»à·à¶¸à¶§ à¶à·à¶»à·à¶«à·à¶ à·à·à¶±à·à¶±:

à·à·âà¶ºà·à¶´à·à¶­à·à¶ºà· à¶±à·à¶à·à·à¶´à·à¶± à¶´à·à¶»à·à¶·à·à·à·à¶ à·à¶ à¶± à¶·à·à·à·à¶­à¶º

à·à¶ à¶± à¶¸à·à¶½à¶ºà· à¶±à·à¶à·à·à¶´à·à¶± à¶´à·à¶»à·à¶·à·à·à·à¶ à·à¶ à¶± à¶·à·à·à·à¶­à¶º à¶à¶¶à¶à· à·à·à¶ºà·à· à·à·âà¶ºà·à¶´à·à¶­à·à·à¶½ à¶±à·à¶à·à·à¶´à·à¶± à¶´à·à¶»à·à¶·à·à·à·à¶ à·à¶ à¶± à¶·à·à·à·à¶­à¶º à·à·à¶±à¶­à· à¶¸à·à¶­à·à¶à·à·à¶à¶§ à¶à¶¯à·à¶½ à¶´à·à¶»à·à¶·à·à·à·à¶ à·à¶ à¶± à¶·à·à·à·à¶­à¶º (à¶à¶¯à·à·à¶»à¶«à¶ºà¶à· à¶½à·à· Firefox à·à· à·à·à¶¯à·âà¶º à¶´à·à¶»à·à¶·à·à·à·à¶ à·à¶ à¶± à¶·à·à·à·à¶­à· à¶±à·à¶à¶»à¶±à·à¶±).

Tips on translating difficult concepts Translating terms representing difficult concepts is a tricky task. Here are some ideas to help you translate terms that do not have equivalents in your language:

Understand the meaning of the term in English. Definitions of a few key terms http://techterms.com/category/internet Know your product and understand the function of the feature. Consider similar ideas for those functions in your culture. Associate a culturally specific image with the meaning and function of the term.

Developing new term bases What is your community's process for identifying and creating a new termbase? Here are a few things to keep in mind:

Avoid overly borrowing English expressions Referencing another language from the same language family may inspire you to come up with your own terms Consider the product target audience (age, level of literacy, education, social and economic status) Will you use loan words from another language or coin new terms in your language to maintain language purity? Is there government requirement or policy to encourage creating new terms for new concepts, or will loan words be sufficient to reach broader masses and expedite new technology adoption? If there are two acceptable scripts commonly used by the general public, what is the commonly used script on the web or government sites? What is the script used by major web technology companies?

Units and Grammar Many elements of unit or grammar do not exist or apply to all languages. If you find one of these elements that does not apply to your language, please remove it from your style guide. For those definitions of units and grammar that apply document the reference used or how it will be applied to the translation.

The translation should strive to achieve proper unit conversions for currency, measurements, etc. for the target audience.

Units and Unit Conversion Date Format How are the date formats for weeks and months expressed in the following forms:

Reference material can be find here: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Date_format_by_country

Calendar view:

Which date is considered the first day of the week, Sunday or Monday? Is Lunar calendar observed? Other regional calendar observed?

Time Format How is time expressed in your language? Including 0-24 hr expression, hour, minute and second.

Numerals How are numerals and percentages expressed in your language?

  • à¶¸à·à¶±à·à¶­à·à¶­à· 5 à¶à¶§ à¶´à·à¶»
  • à¶¢à¶±à·à·à¶»à· 9 à¶¯à·à¶± à¶´à· 9:16 à¶§

Currency

à¶»à·à¶´à·à¶ºà¶½à· 10à¶à·, à¶»à· 100 à¶à·

Units Do you use the imperial, metric or nautical system for measuring weight, distance, etc.? Source strings will use the imperial system (e.g., miles, pounds, feet, gallons, etc.). Target translations should convert imperial metrics to their measurement system.

Names

What are the order of family name and given name in your language? Here is the guideline on the naming convention from w3c.org: Address and Postal Code Format What is the format in your language?

  • Example: most Asian countries start from big to small: [Country] [postal code][state/province][city][district][street number and name][building and suite numbers][addressee]
  • Countries of European languages start from small to big: [addressee][street number and name][building and suite numbers][district][city][state/province][postal code][Country]

Telephone Number format

Space separators between digits can be different for area codes such as State (Province) and City

Spelling And Grammar Checks

Many languages have national or international standards that define spelling and grammar rules. When defining these rules for your community, make reference to those standards wherever possible. Do you have automated tests for spell checking and grammar? List those tools and dictionaries here and how regularly they should be used.

Tense

Do you have standards for verb forms that indicate or express the time, such as past, present, or future, of the action or state? What is your policy on tense consistency for certain use cases? For example, for phrases that ask a user to make an action (like "Download Firefox"), do you use a future tense, a command tense, or a neutral tense? (See: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grammatical_tense)

Word Forms Pluralization What is the appropriate form of expressing pluralization in your language? List all forms of plural forms and examples if there is more than one. Additional discussions can be found Here. https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Localization/Localization_and_Plurals and here: http://www.unicode.org/cldr/charts/latest/supplemental/language_plural_rules.html

Abbreviations

An abbreviation is a shortened form of a word. in English, abbreviations are made by removing most vowels and only using the first 3-5 consonants followed by a period (e.g., abbreviation = abbr.). (see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abbreviation)

Abbreviate text if space is an issue or to make the text easier to read at a glance.

Units of time:

  • Century â 20 à·à¶± à·à¶­à·à¶»à·à·à¶º
  • Decades â 80 à¶¯à·à¶à¶º, 90 à¶¯à·à¶à¶º
  • Months â à¶¢à¶±, à¶´à·à¶¶, à¶¸à·à¶»à·, à¶à¶´à·âà¶»à·, à¶¸à·à¶ºà·, à¶¢à·à¶±à·, à¶¢à·à¶½à·, à¶à¶à·, à·à·à¶´à·, à¶à¶à·, à¶±à·à·à·, à¶¯à·à·à·
  • Dates â à¶¢à¶± 10, à¶¸à·à¶»à· 11
  • Days â à¶à¶»à·à¶¯à·, à·à¶¯à·à¶¯, à¶à¶, à¶¶à¶¯à·, à¶¶à·âà¶»à·, à·à·à¶à·, à·à·à¶± à·à· à¶, à·, à¶, à¶¶, à¶¶à·âà¶», à·à·, à·à·
  • Hours â à¶¸à·à¶±à·, à¶­à¶­à·, à¶´à·.à·., à¶´.à·. (à¶à¶¯à·: à¶´à·.à·. 1, à¶´.à·. 2.30)
  • Other common usages:
  • Examples â à¶à¶¯à·: à¶à¶¯à·à·à¶»à¶«
  • info (no period) â à¶à¶© à¶à·à·à·âà¶º à¶´à¶»à·à¶¯à· à¶à¶­à·à¶±à¶¸à· âà¶­à·à¶»à¶­à·à¶»à·â à¶½à·à· à¶·à·à·à·à¶­ à¶à¶»à¶±à·à¶±.
  • US - à¶.à¶¢. à·à· à¶.à¶¢.à¶.

Acronyms

There is no standard translations of widely accepted acronyms such as CD, DVD, MB, TCP, SMS in Sinhala. So keep them remain in English (see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acronym )

Punctuation

Do you use different punctuation rules in your Firefox localization than what your language standard defines?

  • Example: do you use a period at the end of every user interface element translation or only some? What is the international/national standard for punctuation in your language?

Emphasis

Capitalization is not available in Sinhala.

  • Save, save - à·à·à¶»à¶à·à¶±à·à¶±
  • Edit, edit - à·à¶à·à¶±à·à¶±

please keep original terms as it is in English, in case of entire word in capital letters.

The use of bold, italic, or underline types to express emphasis.

First translate (without considering text formatting) and then make relevant text formatting in respective words or strings.

Hyphens and compounds

What is the appropriate way of using hyphens and compounds in your language? ( https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Compound_%28linguistics%29)

Prepositions and articles

What is the appropriate form of expressing prepositions and articles in your language?

Diacritics and Special characters

Does your language use any special or accented characters and will they be applied and preserved in sort orders, and other aspects of the translation? (see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diacritic)

Quotes

Does your language have a standard use for quotation marks, parenthesis, or brackets?

Whitespace

Does your language require the use of white space around words, sentences, paragraphs, etc.? If so, in what ways? (see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sentence_spacing_in_language_and_style_guides)

User Interface Elements

  • Titles : Should be brief and precise. Localizers can assume that source content reaches 2/3 of the total available line space. This allows localization text to expand and not be truncated or resolved through ellipsis. Title on the final page (meaning no more click through) should allow enough room to display full text.
  • Buttons: Capitalize the first letter of each word. Limit to one or two words. Use verbs that precisely describe the button's action.
    • For example, "Cancel", "Clear History", "Add Email", "Select All", etc.
  • Value Selector Lists: Capitalize the first letter of the first word and the first letter of any proper nouns. Limit to one or two words.
  • Articles: Avoid them where possible. Articles (such as the word "the" in English) should be avoided wherever possible. User interface elements have limited space available for text. Avoiding articles will help ensure that your translations will be accommodated within the user interface.
  • Ellipsis: Ellipsis are often inserted automatically in the UI where strings are truncated. Ellipsis should only be used at high level of UI pages, but not be on the final page (after a series of click-through) where detailed instruction is given. Ellipsis should not be used as a way to solve truncation issue. Focus on making the UI short and precise. The sequence of the sentence structure in another language may not translate well, when a sentence is half finished as such.

General Mozilla l10n style

Accuracy Meaning-based translation When it comes to translation, meaning is everything. A translator needs to understand the source text's meaning exactly. You then find its most closely linked equivalent in your own language, without adding or subtracting meaning in your translation. Finding meaning-based equivalents between languages can be difficult. To help concentrate your thoughts, ask yourself questions like:

  • What does this word/sentence/string mean in English?
  • What is the message the author is trying to send?
  • How would I express that meaning in my own language?

Sometimes translation memory and machine translation tools can offer bad suggestions for a translation. If you use either as part of your translation workflow, make sure to correct the suggestions before submitting them. Avoid literal translation at all costs. Watch out for words that might sound or look the same between English and your language, but have a different meaning. Should not be translated Shortcuts and accesskeys

In Firefox and other software it's possible to use keyboard shortcuts to invoke a specific command. For example, to open a file in Firefox you can press the combination of keys CTRL+O (Cmd+O on Mac). The accelerator key depends on the operative system, but the letter itself is normally localizable. This is what is called a shortcut, or commandkey. For example, the Open Fileâ¦ menu item is stored as

<!ENTITY openFileCmd.label "Open Fileâ¦"> <!ENTITY openFileCmd.accesskey "O"> <!ENTITY openFileCmd.commandkey "o">

The commandkey is stored in openFileCmd.commandkey (sometimes the string has .key in the identifier). Normally you should not localize this key, since shortcuts are often common across the entire operative system (e.g. CTRL+S to Save) or similar products (CTRL+T to open a new tab in most browsers). But it needs to be localized if the letter is not available in your keyboard layout. For example, in Italian the character [ can be accessed through ALT+Ã¨, a command key [ would not work.

In the code fragment above you see also an accesskey defined for Open Fileâ¦. Accesskeys are used to access a UI element from the keyboard. Example: if File menu has an accesskey F, and the Open fileâ¦ menu has O, you can press ALT+F to access the menu, and then O to open a file.

If the label is File, and the accesskey is F, it will be displayed as "File" on Windows and Linux, with an underscored F. If the accesskey was "O", so a character not available in the original label, it will be displayed underlined between parenthesis: "File (O)".

One important thing to determine is if, for your locale, it makes sense to have localized accesskeys: for example, if most users will use a keyboard with a different layout (English), it might make sense to keep the English original accesskey instead of using a letter available in your localization.

Accesskeys, like commandkeys, have their own lines within .dtd and .properties files and are usually identified by .accesskey in the string ID. Variables

Variables should never be translated. You can recognize a variable within a string by its beginning with a specific character (e.g., $, #, %, etc.) followed by a combination of words without spacing. For example, $BrandShortName and %S are variables. You can move a variable around within a string, if the translation of the string requires it. Brands, copyright, and trademark

Brand names, as well as copyright and trademarks should never be translated, nor transliterated into a non-Latin based script. See the Mozilla branding guide for more details.

Translating culture-specific references

At times there will be English content included in Mozilla products or web projects (e.g., marketing campaigns) that makes references to American culture and concepts. When translating these, it is best to find an equivalent cultural reference within your own culture that accurately conveys the meaning of the English reference. For example, an American might say, "Good job, home run!" A home run is a baseball reference for a successful outcome. An appropriate translation would be an equivalent metaphor within your culture. Using soccer as an example, you might translate "Good job, home run!" into "Good job, nice goal!" in your language.

[Add a note about Mozilla culture.] Legal content

Mozilla projects will often contain legal content in the form of user agreements, privacy statements, etc. When reviewing the translation of legal content, Mozilla localizers should do so according to the criteria concerning accuracy, fluency, style, and terminology found within this style guide and according to Mozilla culture and values. Fluency

To produce a fluent translation, not only should the translation follow the language's standard grammar, punctuation, and spelling rules, but it should avoid being ambiguous, incoherent, or inconsistent, and unintelligible.

To avoid ambiguity, the translator must thoroughly understand the meaning behind the source text, including any references that text might include. For example, if the English source text uses the word, "it", the translator must know what "it" is to avoid an ambiguous translation. Clearly understanding the source text will also allow a translator to make the source text's logical connections in their own translation. This helps to keep the translation coherent.

Inconsistency can pop up in many forms. A translator must be consistent in their use of abbreviations, references, and links within each localization project. They must also be consistent with Mozilla and the localization communities' style guides and approved terminology. Abbreviations, like terminology, should come from either a standard reference (like a dictionary of abbreviations) or should follow your language's rules for creating abbreviations. Once used, the abbreviation must remain consistent every place that it is used in the translation. Cross-references (or links) must also be consistently used within a translation. If a text contains a hyperlink URL to a support article in English, the translation should also contain a hyperlink to a translation of that support article (if available) or the English version. Links should not redirect to other pages nor should they be broken and unusable.

Finally, there are times that a translation simply doesn't make sense. It's hard to put your finger on what exactly is wrong with it, but you know it is unintelligible and not fluent. While this is uncommon, it's important to report these unintelligible translations and offer suggestions to correct them.

PouÅ¾Ã­vateÄ¾ovi sa nerozkazuje!

Äasto sa v prekladoch stretÃ¡vame s vÃ½razmi âZobraz, Klikni, PouÅ¾i, Vyberâ a pod. To je nesprÃ¡vne, pretoÅ¾e pouÅ¾Ã­vateÄ¾ovi sa nerozkazuje. SprÃ¡vne mÃ¡ byÅ¥ âZobraziÅ¥, PouÅ¾iÅ¥â, resp. âVyberte, Kliknite naââ¦

Preklad je nutnÃ© otestovaÅ¥

Po dokonÄenÃ­ lokalizÃ¡cie nastupuje fÃ¡za testovania a hÄ¾adania chÃ½b. Kontroluje sa sprÃ¡vnosÅ¥ zobrazenia znakov, Äi reÅ¥azce svojou dÄºÅ¾kou nevhodne nerozÅ¡irujÃº okno oproti originÃ¡lu alebo Äi sa niektorÃ© neprekrÃ½vajÃº. SamozrejmosÅ¥ou je kontrola textu na preklepy a gramatickÃ© chyby.

NÃ¡zov neprekladÃ¡me!

Je mnoÅ¾stvo rozÅ¡Ã­renÃ­, ktorÃ© obsahujÃº v lokalizaÄnÃ½ch reÅ¥azcoch aj nÃ¡zov samotnÃ©ho rozÅ¡Ã­renia. Ten sa zobrazuje v rÃ´znych situÃ¡ciÃ¡ch ako hlavnÃ¡ ponuka, nÃ¡zvy rÃ´znych okien, prÃ­padne v popisnÃ½ch vetÃ¡ch vysvetÄ¾ujÃºcich funkcie a Äinnosti danÃ©ho rozÅ¡Ã­renia. Style Guide Slovenian (sl)

Slogovni priroÄnik za slovensko L10n ekipo

NajlepÅ¡a hvala, da nam pomagaÅ¡ pri prevajanju Mozillinih izdelkov in vsebine! NaÅ¡e delo je odvisno od prostovoljk in prostovoljcev, kot si ti, in veseli smo vsakega novega Älana.

NoÄemo se zadovoljiti s povrÅ¡nimi in dobesednimi prevodi, ki jih lahko skropucamo med preklapljanjem z ene raÄunalniÅ¡ke igre na drugo (Äeprav so marsikje pogosti). Uporabnikom Å¾elimo svoje programe in storitve ponuditi v njihovem jeziku s kvalitetnimi prevodi. Ta priroÄnik vsebuje nekaj nasvetov, kako lahko izboljÅ¡aÅ¡ svoje prevode, ter opiÅ¡e pogoste napake, katerim se je treba izogibati.

Seveda od tebe, sploh, Äe si zaÄetnik pri prevajanju, ne zahtevamo Å¾e od samega zaÄetka popolnih prevodov - drugi smo tu, da ti pomagamo. Tvoje prevode bomo spoÄetka pregledovali in po potrebi popravili, ti pa preleti popravke, poiÅ¡Äi ponavljajoÄe se napake in jih vzemi na znanje za prihodnje prevode. Iz izkuÅ¡enj se nauÄimo veÄ kot iz vsakega priroÄnika!

KakÅ¡en jezik naj uporabljam?

Jezik se lahko razlikuje glede na kontekst - naÅ¡e delo zajema prevajanje od spletne strani s kampanjo za prenos Firefoxa pa do bolj tehniÄnih navodil in pravnih obvestil. Jezik je treba temu primerno prilagoditi, osnovno pravilo pa je: Mozilla smo ljudje in z uporabniki Å¾elimo komunicirati karseda naravno, kot Älovek s Älovekom. Jezik naj bo zato:

  • Äimbolj priljuden in sproÅ¡Äen ter ne pravniÅ¡ki ali robotski.
  • Razumljiv tudi raÄunalnikov neveÅ¡Äemu uporabniku ter ne preveÄ Å¾argonski.
  • Äimbolj Å¾iv in raznolik (to naredi vsako branje prijetnejÅ¡e).

Pri slovenski Mozilli smo zagreti zagovorniki slovenjenja izrazov. Zato se trudimo izogibati tujkam in sposojenkam ter poskuÅ¡amo vse termine prevesti v slovenÅ¡Äino. Npr. certifikat/digitalno potrdilo, e-mail naslov/e-poÅ¡tni naslov, kompatibilen/zdruÅ¾ljiv, verzija/razliÄica ...

Terminologija

Firefox in drugi programi so seveda polni imen za svoje funkcije (Â»Add-on ManagerÂ«, Â»bookmarksÂ«, Â»search engineÂ« â¦). Poleg tega se v skoraj vsakem besedilu na temo raÄunalnikov pojavljajo doloÄeni izrazi, kot so Â»downloadÂ«, Â»toolbarÂ«, Â»settingÂ«, Â»checkboxÂ« in tako dalje.

Za veliko slednjih obstaja cel kup razliÄnih prevodov v slovenÅ¡Äino, od katerih je ponavadi pravilen le en, drugi pa veljajo za Å¾argonske, pogovorne ali kako drugaÄe neustrezne. PopolnejÅ¡i seznam angleÅ¡kih izrazov in slovenskih prevodov zanje sestavljamo tu: https://goo.gl/pKWLmq

Za izraze v Firefoxu, Thunderbirdu, operacijskem sistemu in drugih programih vedno uporabljamo slovenske razliÄice, ki so v slovenskih prevodih Å¾e uveljavljene. Npr. termin Â»Add-on ManagerÂ« je v Firefoxu preveden kot Â»upravitelj dodatkovÂ«, zato uporabljamo ta prevod in ne izumljamo svojih, kot je Â»upravljalnik dodatkovÂ« ali Â»skrbnik za dodatkeÂ«. Ime Windows se nikjer v sistemu ne sklanja (povsod piÅ¡e Â»v sistemu WindowsÂ«), zato se tega drÅ¾imo tudi v naÅ¡ih prevodih in ne piÅ¡emo Â»v WindowsuÂ« ali Â»v WindowsihÂ«.

  • Äe nismo prepriÄani, kako se imenuje kak del vmesnika Firefoxa ali Thunderbirda, preverimo v programu samem ali poiÅ¡Äemo prevod z orodjem Transvision: https://transvision.mozfr.org/

Slovnica in sestava stavkov

Slovnici angleÅ¡Äine in slovenÅ¡Äine sta precej razliÄni in slovenski stavki imajo pogosto drugaÄno strukturo kot angleÅ¡ki. Äe torej pri prevajanju orjeÅ¡ besedo za besedo kot traktor, bodo prevodi skoraj vedno zveneli nenaravno in vÄasih celo nesmiselno. Veliko boljÅ¡e prevode dobiÅ¡, Äe prebereÅ¡ poved(i), razmisliÅ¡, kako bi to povedali po slovensko, in tako tudi napiÅ¡eÅ¡ prevod.

Ni nujno, da je vse prevedeno dobesedno â prej obratno. VaÅ¾no je, da je prevod moÄ brati z enako lahkoto, kot Äe bi bilo besedilo Å¾e v izvirniku napisano v slovenÅ¡Äini. Äe dobesedno prevajamo doloÄene besedne zveze in Äe se ne oziramo na posebnosti slovenÅ¡Äine, si bralec Å¾e po prvem stavku misli Â»KakÅ¡en 'most smartest' prevajalecÂ«.

Äe prevajaÅ¡ daljÅ¡e besedilo, si po opravljenem delu vzemi nekaj minut prediha, nato pa svoj prevod Å¡e enkrat preberi ter se prepriÄaj, da se tudi v slovenÅ¡Äini bere tekoÄe, smiselno in da zveni naravno. Ko se tako vÅ¾iviÅ¡ v vlogo bralca, lahko zaÄutiÅ¡ pomanjkljivosti besedila in narediÅ¡ Å¡e zadnje popravke.

Primer, ki ni za dobesedno prevajanje

Â»Be sure to regularly visit the Plugin Check page to keep your plugins up-to-date.Â«

Prevod Â»PrepriÄajte se, da redno obiÅ¡Äete stran za preverjanje vtiÄnikov, da obdrÅ¾ite vtiÄnike posodobljeneÂ« se ne sliÅ¡i najbolje. V njem nas lahko zmoti naslednje:

  • Besedna zveza Â»Be sure/make sureÂ« v tem kontekstu ni ravno primerno za slovenÅ¡Äino in jo lahko nadomestimo s Äim primernejÅ¡im (npr. velelnikom Â»redno obiskujteÂ« ali Â»priporoÄamo, da redno obiskujeteÂ«).
  • NeskonÄna veriga veznikov Â»da, da, daÂ« daje vtis ÄetrtoÅ¡olÄevega spisa in jo lahko razbijemo z drugimi vezniki.
  • Äe so naÅ¡i obiski strani ponavljajoÄi, jo redno obiskujemo, ne redno obiÅ¡Äemo - uporabiti moramo nedovrÅ¡no obliko glagola.

Bolj smiseln prevod bi bil na primer: Â»PriporoÄamo, da redno obiskujete stran za preverjanje vtiÄnikov in poskrbite, da ostanejo vaÅ¡i vtiÄniki posodobljeni.Â«

Ali: Â»Redno obiskujte stran za preverjanje vtiÄnikov in ohranite svoje vtiÄnike posodobljene.Â« kar je jedrnateje in primerneje za npr. promocijsko kampanjo za stran preverjanja vtiÄnikov.

Äe je kak stavek teÅ¾ko smiselno prevesti

V kolikor se kakega stavka ne da prevesti tako, da bi se v slovenÅ¡Äini sliÅ¡al smiselno, namesto njega vnesi svojega. Dokler besedilo ohrani pomen, bo tudi to v redu. Preberi si kontekst, po potrebi preveri, kaj je sporoÄilo tega besedila, in to ubesedi na svoj naÄin.

Primer: Â»When you restart Firefox and restore your previous session, Firefox will wait until you select a tab before loading it. This keeps Firefox running quickly and smoothly.Â«

Dobesedni prevod bi se glasil: Â»Ko ponovno zaÅ¾enete Firefox in obnovite prejÅ¡njo sejo, bo Firefox poÄakal, da izberete zavihek, preden ga bo naloÅ¾il. To ohranja tek Firefoxa hiter in gladek.Â«

Pri takÅ¡nem prevodu predvsem pri drugem stavku morda komu ne bi bilo jasno, kaj Å¾elimo z njim povedati. Glede na to, kakÅ¡ne so posledice hkratnega nalaganja ogromno zavihkov po obnovi seje (Firefox za nekaj Äasa lahko docela zmrzne), lahko stavek prevedemo tudi tako: Â»Ko ponovno zaÅ¾enete Firefox in obnovite prejÅ¡njo sejo, bo Firefox zavihke naloÅ¾il Å¡ele, ko kliknete nanje. To prepreÄi, da bi se Firefox zaradi hkratnega nalaganja velikega Å¡tevila zavihkov prenehal odzivati.Â«

Preneseni pomeni, Â»marketing languageÂ«

Äe besedilo uporablja prenesene pomene (Â»idiomeÂ«) ali je napisano v Â»marketing languageuÂ« (reklamnem slogu), jih ne prevajaj dobesedno, saj je potem prevod lahko precej neumen. Raje uporabi slovenske stalne besedne zveze ali napiÅ¡i prevod v Â»obiÄajnemÂ«, slogovno nevtralnem jeziku.

Primer: Â»Learn these simple tricks and browse the web like a boss.Â«

Dobesedni prevod Â»NauÄite se teh preprostih trikov in brskajte po spletu kot Å¡efÂ« bi pripisali kakemu zelencu s 24ur.com.

Bolje bi bilo na primer: Â»NauÄite se teh preprostih trikov in si olajÅ¡ajte brskanje po spletu.Â«

Vrstni red besed

Vrstni red besed v povedi v slovenÅ¡Äini ni strogo doloÄen, a ima stavek glede na vrstni red besed razliÄne prizvoke. ObiÄajno velja, da na konec povedi postavimo besedo, ki jo Å¾elimo poudariti.

Primer â okno s seznamom piÅ¡kotkov: Â»The following cookies are stored on your computer:Â«

MoÅ¾en prevod: Â»Naslednji piÅ¡kotki so shranjeni na vaÅ¡em raÄunalniku:Â«

Nekoliko bolje je: Â»Na vaÅ¡em raÄunalniku so shranjeni naslednji piÅ¡kotki:Â«

Prilastki

Prilastki so v slovenÅ¡Äini postavljeni drugaÄe kot v angleÅ¡Äini.

Â»HTML tagsÂ« ali Â»JPG fileÂ« nikoli ne prevedemo kot Â»HTML oznakeÂ« ali Â»JPG datotekaÂ«, temveÄ prilastek postavimo na desno: Â»oznake HTMLÂ«, Â»datoteka JPGÂ«

V primerih, ko je angleÅ¡ka oblika Å¾e povsem prevladala, pa prilastek pustimo, kjer je, in besedi loÄimo z vezajem â tako na primer prevod Â»PIN codeÂ« kot Â»koda PINÂ« zveni nekoliko Äudno, lahko pa napiÅ¡emo Â»PIN-kodaÂ«.

Pogoste napake pri prevajanju â neupoÅ¡tevanje kompleksnosti slovenÅ¡Äine

Pri hitrem in povrÅ¡nem prevajanju pogosto pride do naslednjih nevÅ¡eÄnosti:

Predlogi

Predlog Â»fromÂ« lahko prevedemo kot Â»izÂ« ali Â»z/sÂ«, glede na to, ali je nekaj Â»vÂ« ali Â»naÂ« neÄem.

  • Â»from the menuÂ« -> Â»iz menijaÂ«
  • Â»from the webpageÂ« -> Â»s spletne straniÂ«

Podobno velja za druge â Â»toÂ« -> Â»vÂ«/Â»naÂ« ...

Zaimki

Pri zaimku Â»itÂ« moramo paziti, da ga ustrezno prevedemo kot Â»gaÂ« ali Â»joÂ«, glede na spol tega, na kar se nanaÅ¡a.

Kaj je kaj

Zaradi razliÄnih zakonitosti slovenÅ¡Äine lahko nek angleÅ¡ki stavek prevedemo v stavke s Äisto razliÄnimi pomeni.

Na primer, Â»Default Search SettingsÂ« lahko prevedemo kot Â»Nastavitve privzetega iskalnikaÂ« ali pa tudi Â»Privzete nastavitve iskanjaÂ«. Zato moramo na podlagi konteksta (kje in za kaj je prevod uporabljen) izbrati pravega.

Samostalnik in glagol sta lahko v angleÅ¡Äini enaka. Npr.

  • Â»ArchiveÂ« -> Â»ArhivÂ« ali Â»ArhivirajÂ«
  • Â»Open TabsÂ« -> Â»Odprti zavihkiÂ« ali Â»Odpri zavihkeÂ«

Glagolski vid

Primer: Â»Windows periodically checks for updates.Â«

NapaÄen, a vseeno pogost prevod: Â»Windows obÄasno preveri, ali so na voljo posodobitve.Â«

Bolje je, Äe Â»preveriÂ« napiÅ¡emo v nedovrÅ¡ni obliki: Â»Windows obÄasno preverja, ali so na voljo posodobitve.Â«

Povratni svojilni zaimek (svoj)

NapaÄno: Â»ZaÅ¡Äitite vaÅ¡o zasebnost.Â« Pravilno: Â»ZaÅ¡Äitite svojo zasebnost.Â«.

Drugi uporabni napotki

(Vir: veÄinoma https://wiki.lugos.si/slovenjenje:pravila)

RaÄunalnik je stroj â izogibanje prvi osebi ednine

RaÄunalnik je stroj in ne oseba, torej se, Äe se le da, uporablja brezosebno obliko.

Â»Cannot save your settingsÂ« se prevede v Â»Nastavitev ni bilo mogoÄe shraniti.Â« in ne Â»VaÅ¡ih nastavitev nisem mogel shraniti.Â«

Â»Connectingâ¦Â« se prevede v Â»Povezovanje â¦Â« (in ne Â»Povezujem â¦Â«)

RaÄunalnik nima kaj prositi

Glagola Â»prosimÂ« ne piÅ¡emo, saj gre za anglicizem. V slovenskih navodilih za uporabo zadoÅ¡Äa velelnik. Â»ProsimoÂ« lahko uporabimo, kadar so prosilci skupina ljudi ali organizacija.

Primer: Â»Please select your timezone.Â« â Â»Izberite svoj Äasovni pas.Â«

Imena funkcij

Â»Click the button to open Private BrowsingÂ« prevedemo v Â»Kliknite gumb, da odprete zasebno brskanjeÂ« in ne Â»...da odprete Zasebno brskanjeÂ«.

Datumi, zneski ipd.

V angleÅ¡Äini je obiÄajno mesec naveden pred dnevom, v slovenÅ¡Äini pa obratno. Spremenljivke postavimo v pravilen vrstni red in Äe so loÄene s poÅ¡evnicami ali vezaji, jih nadomestimo s pikami (za pikami pustimo presledek!).
